title: Separatiing Terms
text: Separate the terms so that it forms multiple fractions with the same denominator. It will result in the following: $$\frac{46x^3}{2x^2}+\frac{38x^2}{2x^2}$$
speech: Separate the terms so that it forms multiple fractions with the same denominator. It will result in the following:  fraction, 46 x cubed, over, 2 x squared,  plus fraction, 38 x squared, over, 2 x squared,
pacedSpeech: Separate the terms so that it forms multiple fractions with the same denominator. It will result in the following:   fraction, 46 x cubed, over, 2 x squared,  plus fraction, 38 x squared, over, 2 x squared,

title: Separating Terms
text: What is the result once each fraction term is simplified?
